user_message:
<misra_rule>
MISRA C 2023 Rule 2.1 is: A project shall not contain unreachable code.

</misra_rule>
<response format>
Provide your answer with these fields.
- is_rule_violated: whether the rule is violated or not (true/false),
- scenario: a specific violation scenario.
</response format>
<target_code>
Here is the code of metal_bus_find:
```c
int metal_bus_find(const char *name, struct metal_bus **result)
{
	struct metal_list *node;
	struct metal_bus *bus;

	metal_list_for_each(&_metal.common.bus_list, node) {
		bus = metal_container_of(node, struct metal_bus, node);
		if (strcmp(bus->name, name) == 0 && result) {
			*result = bus;
			return 0;
		}
	}
	return -ENOENT;
}
```
</target_code>
<additional code>Here are the definitions of symbols that are close to the target function metal_bus_find:
#define metal_list_for_each(list, node) for((node)=(list)->next;(node)!=(list);(node)=(node)->next)
...
#define metal_container_of(ptr, structure, member) (void*)((uintptr_t)(ptr)-metal_offset_of(structure,member))
...
struct metal_list {
	struct metal_list *next, *prev;
}
...
struct metal_bus {
	const char		*name;
	struct metal_bus_ops	ops;
	struct metal_list	devices;
	struct metal_list	node;
}
...
extern struct metal_state _metal
</additional code>
<target_code>
Here is the code fragment that you need to analyze:
```c
if (strcmp(bus->name, name) == 0 && result) {
```
Focus on the above code fragment and judge whether it violates the rule 2.1 or not.
</target_code>
scenario: Not violated. The if-branch is reachable: e.g. call metal_bus_find("mybus", &b) where a bus with name "mybus" exists in the list — strcmp(bus->name, name) == 0 and result != NULL, so the body executes and returns 0. (If result is NULL the body is simply skipped; that is intended behavior, not unreachable code. Note: dereferencing bus->name or passing a NULL name would be undefined behavior, but that is not a Rule 2.1 unreachable-code violation.)
